responses.content:
```yaml
leads:
  - headline: Denial of service via long text input
    analysis: |
      The function `dectalk` does not limit the length of the `text` input. A very long text string could cause the service to use up excessive resources, potentially leading to a denial of service.
    cwe: CWE-400
    function_names:
      - dectalk
    filenames:
      - src/index.ts
    classification: slightly promising
  - headline: SSRF via user-supplied text input
    analysis: |
      The `dectalk` function constructs a URL using the user-supplied `text` input as the value of a query parameter. If the underlying service allows redirection or other forms of server-side request manipulation based on user input, it might be possible to exploit this to perform SSRF attacks.
    cwe: CWE-918
    function_names:
      - dectalk
    filenames:
      - src/index.ts
    classification: slightly promising
```

leads.headline: Denial of service via long text input
leads.analysis: The function dectalk does not limit the length of the text input. A very long text string could cause the service to use up excessive resources, potentially leading to a denial of service.

leads.headline: SSRF via user-supplied text input
leads.analysis: The dectalk function constructs a URL using the user-supplied text input as the value of a query parameter. If the underlying service allows redirection or other forms of server-side request manipulation based on user input, it might be possible to exploit this to perform SSRF attacks.
